page.title: 10Questionnaire Survey
page.content: A house to house survey was conducted of people living in 3 villages, collecting information about 75 people. They were asked about place & type of work, shopping habits, place of birth & religion. Nearly all 'everyday items' in each village were bought in Amersham & Chesham, as were most electronic goods. London was the main centre for clothes shopping (30% of people), Watford (22%) and locally (26%) also being important. Furniture followed the same pattern, Wycombe also adding 10%, but some people said that theirs was antique or inherited. The Church of England was the largest religious group represented (62%) while 25% more belonged to other churches, only 4% stating that they did not belong to any religion.
